casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Jerry L. RADLEY, Appellant. WD 80077 Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District. ORDER FILED: December 19, 2017
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied January 30, 2018 Joshua D. Hawley, Attorney General, and Dora A. Fichter, Assistant Attorney General, Jefferson City, MO, Attorneys for Respondent. Jerry Radley, Cameron, MO, Appellant, pro se. Before Division One: Cynthia L. Martin, Presiding Judge, and James Edward Welsh and Karen King Mitchell, Judges

Order

Per Curiam:

Jerry Radley appeals from the denial of his "Motion Requesting Sua Spont[e] Inquiry into Abandonment by Postconviction Counsel," which also alleged that "Counsel Labored Under a Conflict of Interest." Radley argues that the court erred in denying his motion on the ground that the court lacked jurisdiction. Because the court did not clearly err in denying Radley's motion, we affirm. Rule 84.16(b).
